meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that stops the flow of a liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The shutoff on the pipe prevents water from leaking.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the shutoff valve before starting the machine.
meanings.sent3: The little shutoff on the hose decided to take a break today.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a shutoff, halting any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the shutoff made it easy to find in the dark.

meanings.definition: The action of stopping the flow of a liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The sudden shutoff of the gas supply surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: After the shutoff, the room fell silent.
meanings.sent3: The shutoff of the fountain made the ducks look confused.
meanings.sent4: His apology was a shutoff to any further arguments.
meanings.sent5: The shutoff of the music signaled the end of the party.

meanings.definition: To stop the operation or flow of something.
meanings.sent1: Please remember to shutoff the lights before leaving.
meanings.sent2: He had to shutoff the engine to fix the problem.
meanings.sent3: The magician shutoff the water flow with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: She decided to shutoff her phone to enjoy some quiet time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to shutoff the discussion to start the lesson.
